Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand()
      Default Constructor that intializes the hand (a card) of a player along with no bet.
      Hand(double bet)
      Constructor that intializes the hand (a card) of a player with some betting value.
      Hand(java.util.Stack<Card> cards, double bet)
      Constructor that intializes the declared instance variables of class Hand.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Stack<Card> cards()
      Returns The stack of cards.
      void doubledown(Card newCard)
      If a player chooses to double down, then their bet is doubled and must hit.
      double getBet()
      Returns or gets the bet of the player.
      int getHighAceCount()
      Returns or sets the ace count (1 or 11).
      double getInsuranceBet()
      Returns the amount of insurance bet the player bought.
      int getValue()
      Returns or gets the value of the drawn card.
      boolean hasDoubledDown()
      Returns true or false if the player can double down on the bet.
      void hit(Card newCard)
      If a player hits, then a new card is drawn and the values are recalculated, and sets the new updated value.
      boolean isInsured()
      Returns true if the player is insured.
      void placeBet(double bet)
      Sets the bet made.
      void purchaseInsurance(double insurance)
      Throws an exception if a player buys an insurance that is larger than (1/2) of the bet.
      void recalculateValue()
      When an ace is drawn, method recalculates value on whether or not the ace should be a value of 1 or a value of 11 based on the current value state of the player and sets that new value to the ace.
      void setInsuranceBet(double insuranceBet)
      Sets the insurance bet made by a player.
      Hand split()
      Allows a player to split a hand into two new hands depending if the situation can call for it and two new cards ae drawen from the top of the deck.
      boolean splitable()
      Returns true or false on whether or not a player is able to split.
      void stay()
      Allows a player to choose to stay and yield the turn.
      boolean turnOver()
      Returns true or false on whether or not a player chooses to stay.

      • recalculateValue

        public void recalculateValue()
        When an ace is drawn, method recalculates value on whether or not the ace should be a value of 1 or a value of 11 based on the current value state of the player and sets that new value to the ace.

      • stay

        public void stay()
        Allows a player to choose to stay and yield the turn.

        newCard -

      • split

        public Hand split()
        Allows a player to split a hand into two new hands depending if the situation can call for it and two new cards ae drawen from the top of the deck.
        Returns:
        The new hand

        public void purchaseInsurance(double insurance)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
